page.title: 05Public Transport
page.content: Sudbury's shops, market, schools and leisure facilities attract many people from the surrounding villages like Melford, Acton, Clare, Glemsford and Boxted; public transport is therefore important to the area. BUSES-There are six firms running bus services to and from Sudbury, four of these are private. The national companies run services between the larger towns every day but the private firms which visit the villages do not operate on Sundays nor run weekday services later than about 8.00pm. TRAINS-Sudbury is the terminus of a branch line which runs trains to and from Colchester with connections to London and the rest of East Anglia.The service is infrequent and finishes early. The station is unmanned and dilapidated. BY ABIGAIL FLETCHER, EMMA CHARLTON, MAXINE MAYES AND JANICE FORD.
